programme.title: Building Haiti better
programme.short_synopsis: Can Haiti emerge a better country from the rubble of the earthquake there six months ago?
programme.medium_synopsis: It's six months since a devastating earthquake in Haiti killed over 200,000 people. For Assignment Mark Doyle asks if a better country can emerge from the rubble.
programme.long_synopsis:
Six months have passed since one of the deadliest natural disasters in recent history – the devastating earthquake that hit Haiti, killing over 200,000 people. 

For Assignment, the BBC’s International Development Correspondent Mark Doyle asks if a better country can emerge from the rubble.

programme.title: Assignment
programme.short_synopsis: Investigations and journeys into the heart of global events from BBC correspondents

links.title: Listen to Mark Doyle's previous Assignment from Haiti: 10 Days in Haiti
